intro: Linanthus jaegeri, commonly known as Jaeger's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink and white. It has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually clustered in racemes. Linanthus jaegeri is often found in arid environments and is adapted to thrive in low-nutrient soils.
